phrase.item: z
They put one flat stone on that side (and) one flat stone on this side.
The boys choose groups (between themselves).
Then they play from their side.
One boy throws the round stone from his side, (and) he throws a round stone from the other side.
When he has nine, they call it "bɨrnaw" (not sure)
Whoever becomes bɨrnaw first, the others lay out a big stone. They take the big stone and hold fire onto it, he (birnaw) comes closer and hits it.
If he destroys the the house (goal?), he will win.
If they push him back, then the second group will start playing the game.
Whenver they hit the big stone then they will bet between each other.
They will bet that they should give each other such and such if they play.
If they win the game, the one who loses the game, is forced to give whatever they bet.
tʃəkləkbozi (name of the game)
tʃəklək is a stick, the length is 1 meter, 20 centimeters.
It has a five centimeter handle (made of wood).
Then in ʃogɨn holiday boys gather together (and) and chose sides.
Five-six people on one side and another five-six people on the other side.
Whoever has the long stick , they will hold the fire (the small wood).
Whoever doesn't have the long stick, he will hit.
After the first group finishes, the second group will go and hold the fire for them.
(some part are missing checked the book )
kiʃkbozi
kiʃkəj game in a gruss place.
They make six eyes (hole) from one side and six eyes (holes) from another side.
Two people sit around it for having happy time.
In the eyes (holes) they put four stones each.
Then whoever comes, that person will put stones from bottom to the top or from top to the bottom.
During the game if in any eyes (hole) there will be four stones again, that person will say, "My cow delivered".
If for the last eyes (hole) it (the stones) will finish, the person comes from the empty eyes (hole) side and says, " i lick this one (and) take that one".
At the end when they take the last stone, they count all the stones.
Whoever won more stones, there is no bet on that person.
In order to get the bet they kate the person to the place called "blind grandma", the looser will carry all the stones on his hat. They tie his eyes and make him to hide his own hat.
Then they bring him back to the place where they were playing and open his eyes.
He goes and if he finds his place right away, the bet will be equal.
They tell him, "We took you to a blind".
If he doen't find then he will loose the bet.
Cat meow game
All people whoever is present will divide in to two.
Then half will go one side and another half will go to another side.
Then on the ground each person will make a round out of dirt.
Whenever they finish, they look at each other an meow like a cat.
Then the first group will go and the secong group destroys the balls they made out of dirt.
Another group destroys them.
After destroying, they take all (the balls) and count each other balls (made of dirt).
Whoever have a lot of balls will win the game.
They take her also to the "blind grandma".
the they hide his/her hat. if she finds it (the hat) everything will be equal.
If he doesn't find he will loose.
dʒarmodʒaxik
Here two people take a partner.
They might take four partners, five or six partners they can take.
one group, all the memebrs hunch, (and) the other half will go and hide themselves.
These ( first group people) go and look for them.
They they a person (from another group) he will be hit on his back and they say, "tsɨwadop".
Then another (group) will come and hunch, the second (group) once will seek them.
They will find them and also hit in the back saying, "tsɨwadop".
